intro: Dodonaea viscosa subsp. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hoppegrow, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It features small, opposite, narrow ovate leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are often obscured by the foliage. Its fruits are small, woody drupes that mature to a reddish color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance and resilience.
